intro: Arctotis stoechadifolia var. bergii, commonly known as the Berg's arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance. This variety is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
